revision.comment: removed [[Category:Squadrons of the United States Army Air Forces]]; added [[Category:Antisubmarine squadrons of the United States Army Air Forces]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{no footnotes|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox military unit |unit_name= 3d Search Attack Squadron |image= |caption= |dates= 1942-1944 |country= United States |allegiance= |branch= [[United States Air Force]] |type= |role= Antisubmarine Warfare |size= |command_structure= |current_commander= |garrison= |ceremonial_chief= |colonel_of_the_regiment= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles= |notable_commanders= |anniversaries= }} The '''3d Search Attack Squadron''' is an inactive [[United States Air Force]] unit. Its last assignment was with the [[1st Search Attack Group]], based at [[Langley Field]], [[Virginia]]. It was inactivated on 10 April 1944.
==History== Tested electronic equipment and trained crews for its use in antisubmarine operations; antisubmarine patrols, Jan until late 1943.
===Lineage=== * Constituted '''2d Search Attack Squadron (Heavy)''' on 7 December 1942 : Activated on 10 December 1942 : Redesignated: '''2d Search Attack Squadron (Heavy)''' on 22 November 1943 : Disbanded on 10 April 1944.
===Assignments=== * [[1st Search Attack Group|1st Sea-Search Attack Unit (later Search Attack Group)]], 10 December 1942 – 10 April 1944.
===Stations=== * [[Langley Field]], [[Virginia]], 10 December 1942 – 10 April 1944
===Aircraft=== * [[B-18 Bolo]], 1942–1943 * [[B-24 Liberator]], 1943–1944
==References== {{Air Force Historical Research Agency}} * Maurer, Maurer (1983). Air Force Combat Units Of World War II. Maxwell AFB, Alabama: Office of Air Force History. ISBN 0-89201-092-4.
{{Portal|United States Air Force|Military of the United States}}
{{USAAF Antisubmarine Command}}
[[Category:Antisubmarine squadrons of the United States Army Air Forces|003]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1943]]
